author: awiner
msg: TRINIDAD-46: Checkpoint for PPR via XMLHttp
- All the important functionality seems to be working fine at this point, including redirect on navigation and error reporting
- The PPRResponseWriter is installed by the RenderKit, and theoretically we therefore don't even require body or panelPartialRoot for PPR
- However, <body> is currently setting up some JS (in onload) that is otherwise not initialized at all, so panelPartialRoot is probably broken.
- PPR on PDAs (esp. PocketIE) is probably broken, and is definitely untested
- PPR on Portal is not supported, but it wasn't before either
- Cleaned up Core.js to remove a lot of old cruft
- Needed to enhance ReduceJavascriptMojo to copy .js files recursively, instead of just in the top directory

author: jjohnston
msg: Enable the FOP 0.9x block in the build now that the appropriate artifacts are in the central repository
